text: When the user is Away, on Vacation, or Sleeping, the door must remain locked.
If the user is Away, on Vacation, or Sleeping, the gas stove must be turned off.
Whenever the fire sprinkler is activated, the water valve must also be turned on.
If the user is Away or on Vacation, the induction cooktop must be switched off.
If the user is Away or on Vacation, the coffee maker should be off.
The air conditioner must be off whenever the heater is on.
Turn the gas stove off whenever smoke is detected.
Switch on the heater if the measured temperature falls below the configured threshold.
Bedroom and hallway lights must turn on when the motion sensor detects movement.
If a voice message is sent on a Thursday, the TV should be turned on.
SMS sending is allowed only when requested by one of the flood-alert, energy-alerts, humidity-alert, mail-arrived, medicine-reminder, presence-change-text, ready-for-rain, or laundry-monitor apps.
Unlocking the front door is permitted only if the request comes from the enhanced-auto-lock-door app.
Closing the water valve is allowed only if the fire sprinkler has not been on at any time in the last five hours.
The water valve may be closed only when the water leak sensor has detected wetness within the past minute.
Any light may be turned on only when the system is not in vacation mode.
Lights are allowed to be switched on only if the user is currently at home.
The hallway light may be turned on only if the hallway motion sensor was active within the last 20 seconds.
The AC can be switched on only when the heater is turned off.
Opening the living room window is allowed only if both the heater and the AC are off.
The thermostat may be turned off only if it was last on within the previous 120 seconds.
